intro: Lepadanthus flexuosa, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in spring. Lepadanthus flexuosa is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
